people set out pumpkins and other decorations .
bracelets | charms and rings to ward off evil spirits | or bring good luck .
craftsmen set to work making these charms for those who believe | or would like to believe | and set them out for sale .
output.sentences: In autumn our town's harvest festival is slated to begin.
We set pumpkins on our doorstep, which lets people going by know we are participants in the festival.
My favorite stand at the festival sells traditional jewelry.
There are beautiful rings that are said to ward of evil spirits.
They set out these rings for sale early and I always buy several, never forgetting to congratulate the craftsmen on their ingenuity.
